website_summaries.verdict: A little pricey, but they give you more than a dozen design options for adding style.
pros: A soft exterior keeps these retainers from being uncomfortable when the strap rubs against your skin
Neoprene material will float if you drop the eyewear retainer in the water
Multiple design choices so you can personalize your style with the retainer
cons: Difficult to fit onto some eyeglasses
You'll pay a little more for these stylistic designs versus solid colored options

customer_reviews.title: It floats
customer_reviews.text: Took a photo of sunglasses in a pot, with and without the floating strap. It works! Ready for vacation. I like that you can adjust it from being tight enough to retain the glasses on your head (by pushing the strap up onto the temples) to loose enough to hang around your neck (by pushing the strap toward the end of the arms). I have skinny temples on my sunglasses, max width 3/8”. If your glasses have wide temples, you can probably use these in the loose configuration but not the tight one.
customer_reviews.author: Genevieve

customer_reviews.title: Won't hold sunglasses securely.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these specifically for the ability to not lose my sunglasses in the water. I looked at all the pictures and instructions to make sure they were attached to my glasses properly. First time I jump into the lake, glasses slide right out and sink, the strap did however float so if you're looking for a great floating strap this is it. Otherwise, don't waste your money, lost my favorite pair of sunglasses with these.
customer_reviews.author: steve c

customer_reviews.title: Did not float but A++ customer service
customer_reviews.text: I wear Maui Jims Peahi's. Maybe the material floats without glasses attached, but I tested in the sink and they did not float. Based on that I feel the description is misleading. Ukes customer service reached to me unsolicted so I changed my rating to neutral. They offered to make it right. My wife uses lanyard to keep glasses around her neck so at least they are getting used. I bought another brand for fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D.

customer_reviews.title: Not functional. Too bunkly, causes ears to fold outwards.
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand how these have received good reviews... They were nearly impossible to get onto the glasses to begin with, and once that was finally achieved, I discovered that they add so much bulk behind the ears that it forces the ears to fold outward... The design was cute, but they just aren't functional. I am in the process of returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Sunnyshine

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and I got to test them on a ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product and I got to test them on a recent trip to Hawaii. Easy to pull the strap onto my Ray Bans and I tested them out by floating the combination in shallow water, they worked as advertised. Then I gave them a real test by jumping into the ocean feet first with my sunglasses on with Ukes attached. Sure enough, the glasses and strap went over my head...and...my glasses with Ukes still attached were floating not far from me when I came to the surface!
customer_reviews.author: Duncan C

customer_reviews.title: This strap was pretty but too large for a snug fit to keep ...
customer_reviews.text: This strap was pretty but too large for a snug fit to keep glasses on while gardening. Because it did not fit my need, 7 Source credited my account without my having to return product. It's a pleasure to deal with a company that places customer satisfaction a high priority. I recommend this company!
customer_reviews.author: Largoann

customer_reviews.title: They Work...
customer_reviews.text: The strap worked on my plastic Oakley sunglasses with prescription lenses. It's the reason I got them. I didn't want my expensive prescrips sinking to the bottom of the lake. However, I have not tried them on my metal Oakleys as of yet. When I do I will try to remember to update my review. The only downfall is that your neck does get warm out in the summer heat when resting on your neck. When you're wearing the sunglasses you do not have that issue. Not a defect. Just a matter of fact.
customer_reviews.author: MrDrew

customer_reviews.title: These are the best, I want more
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing and will purchase more in other colors/patterns. It's easy to slip onto your frames, you don't have to force it like some. It weighs nothing. I don't even feel it on my neck when my sunglasses are hanging. It's soft and comfortable. The colors are vibrant. I slide the strap as far up onto the temples/arms of my Persols when not in their case as it doubles nicely as protection. They're so easy to adjust while wearing if you want your glasses to hang higher or lower or fit more snugly. And they stay put. Some straps you have to fight and push/pull and that's annoying and can bend your frames. Highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Hudson Marr

customer_reviews.title: The product is poorly designed and does not work.
customer_reviews.text: This product is stupid. The material isn’t flexible enough to fit around any pair of glasses or sunglasses I own and honestly I don’t see how it would even work on the most standard eye glass design. The material is folded over length wise on the ends then blind stitched to make the hole for the ear resting part of the glasses to fit in but the resulting hole is sooooo small it’s absoulely useless. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Brian R

customer_reviews.title: cannot be attached to my Oakleys or Costas. tried 4 different pair.  dud. in the trash
customer_reviews.text: out of the box loved this. but then found them impossibly to fit onto 4 pair of Oakley and Costa glasses with varying ear pieces. the part that slips over the earpiece is very tight and will require a pretty sharply pointed end to thread them on and must not have a rubber over-molded feature like the Oakley. it simply wont slide through no matter how long you mess with it. tried using a guide like a pencil but was useless. in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: texinstyle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sunglasses holder
customer_reviews.text: These are the perfect sunglasses holder. Very easy to slip on my sunglasses without splitting the opening to the strap or struggling with the glasses. The pattern is bright and tropical. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Gunson

customer_reviews.title: These are great! Very stylish and functional!
customer_reviews.text: Don't give up if it's hard to get them on your sunglasses! Just keep trying. They'll go on eventually, and then you won't lose your $100 sunglasses because you're bad at paddle boarding and refuse to just wear free sunglasses when you are on the water. These are a great buy and I even got a message from the owner of the company after ordering, with tips for how to fit them to sunglasses with larger ear pieces, and asking whether I have any questions or need anything. Great service, great product. I'm a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: sarah m. beck

customer_reviews.title: Some sell a 2 pack for the same price but this is HIGH END quality.
customer_reviews.text: I compare this to others that are 2 packs for the same price but this is high end quality with a sheen / shine luxuary feel to it. It's like buying the top 6 name brands clothes vs big box stuff. You get what you pay for. I love these. I bought 4 as gifts! if the ends are too loose -- I use either clear office magic tape 1 or 2 layers ( tape it 1-3mm above the glasses ends for tight fit ) or electrical tape to make the ends slightly thicker so the inserts won't slide out. If you change your mind, use rubbing alcohol to remove the tape gunk.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: I am trying to put this strap on sunglasses. The edge of the strap on the ends, are sewn along it's edge to form a tube. One end of the strap fits so loose it slides right off the glasses. The other end is IMPOSSIBLE to slide on. Also the sewn ends are sewn backwards. If the strap were to slide onto the glasses, one end of the sewn part would face down and the other end would face up. I wish I could give a negative star rating, but I'll have to accept giving a single star rating. This strap is a complete waste of your time and money. I am returning it. Shocker.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: These retainers were very poorly designed and constructed. Regardless of what their instruction video leads you to believe, these will NOT fit on sunglasses with 12-15mm width. Also, the sewing on the pair I received (and returned) was defective. The seams to attach the sunglasses was upside down. Consequently the name UKES was upside down. I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen G. Finn

customer_reviews.title: Ukes don't pukes
customer_reviews.text: Hard to write a review when I've only used them once. They fit my Ray Ban sunglasses and were easy to put on. They are lightweight and comfortable. They could however be slightly longer in length. Getting them over your head is a close fit. At least for me. Do they float, I don't know, I didn't drop my glasses in the lake to test them. Price was reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Depending on the style of the temples the glasses may fall off the strap
customer_reviews.text: I like the style and comfort. But I found the temple may slip off from the holder when you remove the glasses. It usually happens only to one of the two temples, so I have not lost any of my glasses. Also if you don't write the review right away, the seller will email you repeatedly、which was annoying to me, as I want to write reviews when I am available. Otherwise it is a good holder.
customer_reviews.author: Shanti Moon

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and effective
customer_reviews.text: I did have to order this item 3 times, due to Amazon related issues. The seller was very helpful. the straps' inserts for the bows are sewn super tight. This tight sewing makes it tough to get your sunglasses through, but also distorts the image and makes the material look super worn out even when you first get them. I'd look at the seam allowance and see if you can effectively reduce the allowance by 1/8 of an inch or so to account for wayfarer type sunglasses. (As those are still pretty popular)
customer_reviews.author: Rhugh

customer_reviews.title: Save Your Sunglasses!
customer_reviews.text: I work on a dive boat and I dropped my Costas in the canal during work the other day. Luckily I was able to retrieve them, and a friend who has a pair of sunglasses with an Uke's safety strap recommended I get one too because the neoprene material floats, unlike my previous sunglasses strap. I love the variety of patterns to choose from, and I am so glad I bought my Uke's. No more diving for sunglasses!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the buy!
customer_reviews.text: I use these to keep my glasses on my face around my 3 yr old or to take off while I'm reading and leave them around my neck. I had purchased a 3 pack of a different brand and all 3 fell apart within two months. These feel sturdier and thicker. I plan on ordering more. The design is beautiful and its nice to see a glasses strap thats girly.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit "good" sunglasses
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for trip to Hawaii. They did not fit any of out sunglasses (we have multiple different brands and styles, rayban, oakley, nike) and none fit. The hole is just too small. Missed returning them by 2 days :( Guess we should have tried them before we left.
customer_reviews.author: B. Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought this sooner
customer_reviews.text: After losing three pairs of sunglasses into the water, I finally smartened up and bought this. Should have done it sooner. Granted, its a little expensive for what it is (just a small piece of neoprene), but still, I would have saved hundreds had I gotten it sooner. Plus, it looks cool in a fun 80s/90s way
customer_reviews.author: KJay

customer_reviews.title: Great way to keep your glasses close!
customer_reviews.text: Grabbed these before my recent trip it Colorado for rafting and mountain climbing. They did exactly what I needed them to do. When driving to Colorado I used them to keep my sunglasses handy when driving through rain and heavy clouds. While I was hiking they were handy to keep my sunglasses accessible while hiking through dense trees. Rafting they kept my glasses on my head when we hit some class IV rapids.
customer_reviews.author: sam cockrell

customer_reviews.title: LOVE the mountain graphics but 100% could not get them ...
customer_reviews.text: LOVE the mountain graphics but 100% could not get them on my Warfarer Ray-Bans. Slipped right over my Ray-Ban aviators but would never fit anything that is any bigger than a wire frame. Couldn't even stick a pencil in it. If you don't have wire frame glasses these will not fit.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Plantt

customer_reviews.title: Fits great, easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE the print, colors are vibrant and very pretty. Seriously not understanding why people are having so many problems getting the strap on their glasses. As you can see the arms on my glasses are quite large and I had no issues AT ALL getting them on. Strap is lightweight and fits comfortably and doesn’t bother my ears. Not sure if they float yet, will update my review after they’ve been used.
customer_reviews.author: Kaleigh

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes only one brand of sunglasses and has lost more than one pair on the lake.I got these hoping the next time it would make it easier to find them. While they didn't float(his lens are glass) it was possible to get them before they sank never to be seen again.
customer_reviews.author: MBH

customer_reviews.title: love this sunglass strap
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sunglass strap because the last time I went on vacation, I lost my favorite pair of sunglasses when a wave hit me too hard. The grip on this for my new sunglasses was very tight and a good length for when I'm not wearing my sunglasses on my face. Cute designs, too. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks sharp works well
customer_reviews.text: These are sharp and comfortable. Use these on my sunglasses for the boat because I’m a moron and constantly drop things in the water. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: chamber

customer_reviews.title: Well done...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to keep my glasses from falling off my face while having to wear a mask at my employment. I had no trouble placing them on my plastic temples. Mine aren't overly large, making them easy to slide over them. If you have overly large temple ends, I wouldn't suggest these. The included documentation shows that it can be done, but it will take some adjustment. Overall, the material is strong, lightweight, and very comfortable around my ears. Great job Ukes!
customer_reviews.author: E. Pichon

customer_reviews.title: Cobijas
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Ukes I have bought. The first pair was for my wife's sunglasses. I am using them on my Costa Fantail sunglasses. Much like it says in the description, these can be really hard to put onto your sunglasses if they have rubber on the arms. If you use a pen to stretch the neoprene beforehand and then use a twisting motion to attach the straps they will eventually go on. If you plan on changing them often that might be a problem. Even though I know from experience that they will float, I will still probably take them off in the ocean.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hold good so you don’t lose your glasses in the water but I don’t use them on land
customer_reviews.text: I got these so that when I’m working or on the boat or Jetske I don’t lose my glasses as easy after losing four pairs of Ray-Ban’s in the ocean I decided that it’s time to get one of these. I don’t really like the fee or styles so I only put them on when I’m on the water.
customer_reviews.author: Dabloesco

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit wider tipped glasses!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The pattern and quality was great, but these did not fit my Shady Rays sunglasses. They would fit sunglasses with skinny tips much better and I am sure would be a great product. Did not test if they float as they don't fit on my glasses, but it feels like it would. Also there were some strings frayed upon arrival. Overall giving a 3-star review because it is not specific from the product description that these wont fit all glasses and the strings came frayed.
customer_reviews.author: Cole Cudd

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, secure fit.
customer_reviews.text: These worked great for my trip to the water park. My sunglasses stayed secure all day and the strap didn't rub behind my ears like the last one I tried. I have Oakley prescription sunglasses and they fit just fine. The one I ordered for my husband didn't work with his Oakley's due to the rubber on the sunglasses. It would try to peel off when trying to force the strap on.
customer_reviews.author: Mary K. Louk

customer_reviews.title: So confortalbe I forgot they were on!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these, bought two pair for when we on board a sail boat. Tried them on to check them out and got busy, several hours later, realized that they were still on and my glasses hadn't slipped down during that whole time. Not what I expected, but a great side note!
customer_reviews.author: Cal

customer_reviews.title: Functional/worth it
customer_reviews.text: I got a pair of these for my boyfriend and I for a trip to Hawaii where we spent our time doing outdoors activities (hiking, kayaking, boat cruises, etc). These sunglasses straps worked perfectly for both of us. They kept our sunglasses safe and secure with us throughout all of these activities. We liked them so much that were still using them for different activities back home (lots of kayaking). These are perfect for the price!!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia L

customer_reviews.title: You'll never be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several Ukes recently and in the past, for myself and for others. Not one single time have I or others receiving these as gifts had a single negative comment. Keep up the great work on these products. 😎< "(D2)>{{ Don
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thought I was prepared for the beach
customer_reviews.text: The first time I wore them I got hit by a big wave as I was swimming it pulled off my glasses, I had this on it they did not float in my brand new prescription sunglasses were gone.
customer_reviews.author: M. Shepski

customer_reviews.title: Not a universal fit.
customer_reviews.text: If your glasses have a larger end to the earpiece, these will not work for you. The neoprene did not expand much at all, and definitely not enough to accommodate my glasses. If you have very thin, wire frames, this will probably work for you.
customer_reviews.author: HealthyBody

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and comfort!
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of prescription Maui Jim sunglasses and wanted a way to keep them safe while out at the beach and bike riding. This strap is attractive, comfortable, and secure. The sunglass arms are 5/8" thick and it wasn't easy slipping the strap on. I used a pencil to widen the opening and tweezers to help slip them on. Took awhile, but now that it's on I know the glasses are secure and won't slip off. Very happy with the purchase. As a matter of fact, I'm ordering one for my regular glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Debra J. Ruffino

customer_reviews.title: Good Product - Prompt Service
customer_reviews.text: Planning on a long trip to a sunny location, wanted a sun glass strap that was useful and a bit festive. Found this online and it looked good - reasonable price, great design, so I ordered it. I was shocked when it showed up the next day! Great service. The quality of the strap is excellent, rugged neoprene, comfortable and looks 'neat'.
customer_reviews.author: John H. Degnan

customer_reviews.title: Colorful and good looking!!!
customer_reviews.text: ust received my Ukes sunglasses strap last week before the 4th of July weekend. Wore them on our boat and my glasses felt very secure even in windier conditions. Not sure about whether my sunglasses would float with a Ukes strap on them but it’s possible. Colorful and good looking!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Gillam

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable in a sweaty situation and washable after sweaty situation.
customer_reviews.text: I thought I already answered this but here we go again. I wasn't able to use them until this afternoon when my gargoyles arrived. They are what I hoped for and expected. They fit my gargoyles perfectly, are comfortable and washable which is great because I purchased these glasses for sporting activity and I bought the Uke's for that specific purpose. They are a little wider than the croakies I was used to but that's fine. So all in all I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: stevencneedham

customer_reviews.title: Colorful just like picture
customer_reviews.text: Bright and colorful just like the picture. These are adjusted by how far you slide the ear piece cover forward. NOTE: these do not adjust to feel snug. Nor have I tried the floating aspect. However, they will keep the eyeglasses from flying or dropping off easily. I bought these to go canoeing but use them in front of computer. I take my glasses off to work on computer with this strap I hang them off my neck. Works great for this application.
customer_reviews.author: Bee Cool Travel

customer_reviews.title: Durable and lightweight sunglasses straps
customer_reviews.text: These took me a long time to attach to my sunglasses (just because the sunglasses arms were a bit wide at the end) but once I put them on they did not budge. I wore these in Hawaii for hikes, on the beach, and even in super high winds and they kept my glasses secure even though I couldn’t even feel that the straps were there because they were so light! Highly recommend. I got the blue geometric pattern and it was cute without being too over the top.
customer_reviews.author: Brogan Sheehey

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for our girls, who were heading to Colorado to go hiking and rafting... they worked GREAT for their Oakley sunglasses and even with the ones they bought at a gas station... they were scared of losing their expensive sunglasses, so they tried out the straps on some cheapie ones. They're very happy with them and said they are quite comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle Cline

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, Great Product ... But they do not float.
customer_reviews.text: These were the most promising straps we purchased, unfortunately they LIKE ALL OTHERS (we've purchased many) do not float with a pair of normal weight sun glasses attached. They are absolutely perfect for walking, hiking, biking.
customer_reviews.author: Mary in New Lenox

customer_reviews.title: Little Clunky. Great Style.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for really. They're cool looking and fun, but the stitching makes it tough to fit most shades these days. I've managed to cram most of my sunglasses in there, but it required some ripping. They also don't feel comfortable over the ear due to the bulkiness, but that could simply be my own personal unfamiliarity with this type of product.
customer_reviews.author: PD

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: It is everything it should be! I wished I had thought about my color choice a little more before I purchased though. I am on the water a lot and a black sunglasses retainer is very hard to see on the water.
customer_reviews.author: meagan freeman

customer_reviews.title: this is a life saver
customer_reviews.text: I am frequently changing between my reading glasses and sunglasses when going in and out of stores. unfortunately I tend to lay down my sunglasses and lose them. This keeps me from losing my sunglasses . They strap is light weight and not a distraction. I like the feel, color and It was very easy to put on. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: jedipeg

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit Ray Ban Wayfarer
customer_reviews.text: The holes for the sunglasses frames were very small. I tried the "pencil method" to open the hole up a little more but could only get them partially on the frames. They look good other than the fact that they don't fit lol
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Alldredge

customer_reviews.title: They do NOT float
customer_reviews.text: They don't float at all. I tried them in my friends pool and they 'floated' to the bottom of the pool. Good thing I tested them before I went out in the ocean with my Ray Bans!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If your glasses have wider sides, pass
customer_reviews.text: Super cute, appear to be made well. However, they do not fit my Costa glasses. (Loretto) they have the slightly thicker sides. I tried my cheap aviator, I was able to squeeze those in. But were uncomfortable. Contemplating a return.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon T

customer_reviews.title: Strap is made well.
customer_reviews.text: The strap is made well and has a lovely scene. However, (and it is my bad) I figured it would be adjustable. The purpose of getting it was to hold my glasses to my face when I am doing yardwork/ They slip when I sweat. I may just cut the band and sew Velcro to either side. Not your fault. I assumed, and you know what that means.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne K Kinsler

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Ukes!
customer_reviews.text: We love our Ukes! Now we can paddle board and feel good knowing our sunglasses are secure and they won't be sinking to the bottom of the river. Thank you Ukes!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. My glasses frequently fall off of my face when I look down, and this strap prevents that from happening. Initially, I bought them to use while I was in Maui so that I could look down at sea life while on a boat. They’re light weight, quality made and very useful.
customer_reviews.author: drew c.

customer_reviews.title: Awful - Delamination since April '18
customer_reviews.text: Have worn the strap no more than once a week or so, never swimming, rarely wet, and yet in four months the strap has completely delaminated, leaving a colored cloth band on one side, and the matching cloth with foam body on the other. Not even wearable now. Very disappointed in the quality, especially at this price point. See attached picture taken yesterday
customer_reviews.author: John B. Day

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t easily accommodate fatter ends to sunglasses
customer_reviews.text: The opening on these don’t stretch enough to easily accommodate and attach to the ends of most sun glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Swenson

customer_reviews.title: Ukes Premium Sunglass Strap
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my mother. She keep losing here eyeglasses. So far I have not seen her with out the Ukes strap. So my deduction on the product is it is great. Matches a Nike Sweatshirt she owns. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: James R.

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy
customer_reviews.text: Really cute! Super easy to slip on and wicked comfy behind my ears when I’m on the water —can’t tell if they will cause the glasses float if I fall in the water yet..,so 4 stars for now
customer_reviews.author: k simmons

customer_reviews.title: They do the job.
customer_reviews.text: They do the job. I don’t like how wide the strap is. I feel like I have something hanging around the back of my neck - which I do when using these. I only use them while sailing and feel very comfortable that my glasses won’t end up in the water.
customer_reviews.author: TR

customer_reviews.title: I also really like the Hawaiian pattern
customer_reviews.text: It does float. I tested that. I also really like the Hawaiian pattern. But the picture example looks like this strap will fit wide ear-piece sunglasses, but mine did not. I had to unstitch it and restitch it so it would fit my Ray Bans ear pieces. It still barely fit but it wasn't worth returning.
customer_reviews.author: NLD

customer_reviews.title: Look great - won't float.
customer_reviews.text: The look great and the quality is good, but the big problem is they won't float my glasses. I have 3 pair of Rx sunglasses and the only one that won't sink to the bottom of the 5 gallon bucket weighs in at 1 ounce. The other two weighing 1.2 and 1.3 ounces go right to the bottom 5 gallon bucket
customer_reviews.author: Mike B

customer_reviews.title: Ukes Premium Sunglass Strap
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put on my new prescription glasses. They are light and I love the pineapples on them. I bought them for going on my boat because they float. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah M Whitefall

customer_reviews.title: Super useful for the waterpark
customer_reviews.text: This thing saved me at a waterpark. I'm super blind so I had to have my glasses on. Most people at the waterpark had to take their glasses off and store them somewhere, but I was able to keep mine on because this cut them secured. It is pretty comfortable and fit my glasses and head quite well. It definitely looks pretty dorky though, but that is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wide arm ended sunglasses won't fit in the strap ends, but beautiful & sturdy strap.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I bought this strap for my husband & his sunglasses hv alittle wider end arm & they don't fit in the strap end points/ sleeve. He should be able to use them on another pair, we'll see.
customer_reviews.author: MoolaChecker

customer_reviews.title: Answer to a problem
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of loosing my Maui Jim sunglasses by putting them on my head or collar. These are a great answer to where do you put them when you’re not wearing them
customer_reviews.author: MV

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution to avoid losing good sunglasses!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic to keep the sunglasses available for easy on/easy off, without losing them! My husband and I kayak, fish, hike, ride bicycles and a motorcycle ... and have several grandchildren’s hands to hold during various activities, where we were forever losing good sunglasses. I finally got smart and bought these... now we have several pairs. We keep them in the bike bags, glove compartment, and kayak bags so we always have them handy.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Benford Montague

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and works too
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought SEVERAL different sunglasses straps looking for one that was colorful and cute AND functional. This blows all of them away. I use them on my rayban new wayfarers and they never slip off
customer_reviews.author: RedDixieCup

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and attractive
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this strap for my sunglasses, as I have lost 2 pair recently. This strap is bright, comfy and stays put on my sunglasses. I should not lose sunglasses again!
customer_reviews.author: Va Virgo

customer_reviews.title: great for a float trip
customer_reviews.text: But please be aware that these will not work with certain models of Raybans. They are just too small to slip over the ends of the ear pieces. Just way too tight to work.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mikkelsen

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't float
customer_reviews.text: Pattern is cute; a little thick of a band. Only got to use them twice - first time, they floated in the pool (trial). Second time was on a lazy river, got flipped over a tube, they did not float or resurface :( Bye bye sunglasses and strap. Will not purchase again for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Great for activity, lightweight and good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a strap so my sunglasses stopped falling off my head. The UKES strap is a great solution. It is lightweight so when I am running or hiking, I don't even notice it is there. When I need to remove my sunglasses, they provide a comfortable strap that holds the glasses securely around my neck. I found this useful when rummaging in a bag or taking a seat to rest somewhere. I was able to keep my sunglasses connected to me instead of falling off my head or setting them on the ground to get dirty or risk getting stepped on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Oakley’s
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality product and beautiful. But, be aware, it does not fit any of my sunglasses! The band is much too narrow to allow use on any glasses other than the most thinnest of wire rim! The manufacturer seem aware of this flaw, as they sent email on possible ways to modify their product to conform to basic wearer requirements. If you’re wearing Ray-Ban’s or Oakley’s you might wanna consider the fit!
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Cannot use
customer_reviews.text: I was not able to fit it on any of my sunglasses. The holes were much too tight. I tried shoving chopsticks in them to stretch them out, but it was a no-go.
customer_reviews.author: Longrifle

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and stylish
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my friend for the summer time and he said it was very lightweight and comfortable. And it fit onto different sizes of sunglasses. The patterns are also super fun!
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: Would pass on these in favor of more secure
customer_reviews.text: These are a little lame. Bought many doffeeent versions, these were worst. Big and cumbersome and don’t hold glasses to your head like others do.
customer_reviews.author: Maryion

customer_reviews.title: Nice strap bright colors
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality and thicker than my Croakies. I put them on a pair of Coach sunglasses that have a wide tip at the end of the arm. At first I thought it doesn't fit but after working them on for a few seconds they fit great and my glasses were snugly in them.
customer_reviews.author: LSmith09

customer_reviews.title: A strong option
customer_reviews.text: The strap does hold very tightly onto the eyeglass 'arms'. I just found the strap to be a bit bulky around the ears. Of course I do wear these while fishing and have them on my head for several hours at a time, so maybe just me and my issue. Overall very happy with the product and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Loved my pair until they disappeared - ordering a couple now replacement pairs now. It's a little bit of work to get them on a thicker frame sunglasses, however it's possible. Might try using some cornstarch next time to slide them on.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Porter

customer_reviews.title: Keeps glasses attached when I take an unexpected dunk in the lake
customer_reviews.text: I like the glass holder. It serves the purpose for buying them...to not lose the glasses when I take an unexpected dunk in the lake off the paddle board.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: GREAT STRAP
customer_reviews.text: No complaints at all for this strap. It is very light weight and sturdy. The colors are great and do not fade. Will probably order another.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy B

customer_reviews.title: They FLOAT!
customer_reviews.text: Tested these out boating and they passed. I live in Colorado and have lost many pairs of sunglasses on the river and lakes. These are the first pair of sunglass straps that actually float. Plus they're incredibly cute. I wear prescription sunglasses so losing them is incredibly annoying and expensive.
customer_reviews.author: ColoradoSunshine

customer_reviews.title: Don't fit sunglasses.
customer_reviews.text: I can't find a single pair of sunglasses this fits on. I purchased a different brand instead and am much happier. I gave these away to some poor sap who'll find out for himself how these won't work.
customer_reviews.author: Brian A.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome strap, tight fit, great customer care!
customer_reviews.text: I love this strap, but when it didn't fit onto my sunglasses I was bummed. Then I got a pre-emptive email from their founder with detailed, visual instructions for how to fit the strap over my super large side piece ends. After letting them sit with a large pen inside each opening of the strap, my sunglass side pieces fit right in, but still snuggly. Now I have the awesome strap that I wanted, on the sunglasses that I love - perfect!
customer_reviews.author: matt lyden

customer_reviews.title: cute, functional, easy to assembly but not the comfiest
customer_reviews.text: pinched my ears due to how thick the part attached to the sunglasses are pushing at my ears. I liked that they floated and are cute though. good enough for me
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn’t buy these again
customer_reviews.text: They float, the pattern looks good. HOWEVER, due to the way they are packaged they come creased. I’ve tried ironing them. Soaking them in water and they still look awful because of the fold in them that won’t come out.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Woodruff

customer_reviews.title: Prevents glasses from sinking in lake. 👍🏼👍🏼
customer_reviews.text: After losing my favorite sunglasses in the lake I was looking for something to prevent the new sunglasses from sinking should they fall off again. This strap is great. It’s light and buoyant enough to keep my sunglasses from sinking. Good price. Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lara

customer_reviews.title: Glasses with larger ends.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure that the strap was going to fit my sunglasses, as they have larger ends. Luckily, I received an email that provided a trick: insert a pen into the opening over night, allowing it to stretch just enough to fit snuggly. Love the floral print.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Hutchison

customer_reviews.title: Buy TWO!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I'd bought two of these as my glasses were secure while boating in Mexico but my daughter's glasses flew right off into the ocean! Great product, lightweight, great selection of designs, waterproof, definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SherC

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: My husband loved it. We spend a lot of time swimming, camping, and being active outside. I don't know how many pairs of sunglasses he's lost in the past year, but hopefully this will ensure the most recent pair doesn't get lost in the water. We tested it out this weekend and they do float well. I'd recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Good strap, great designs, narrow openings.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Ukes strap to use with my Costa Broadbill sunglasses. Unfortunately, the opening of the Ukes band is way too narrow. I have an old pair of Costa aviator style glasses which work well with the Ukes.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: No on and off privileges
customer_reviews.text: These were super difficult to install on my wayfarer-type sunglasses, but once they were on I never worried about them coming off. I'd rather be able to install and uninstall at will, but otherwise they are great.
customer_reviews.author: Lorin Baeta

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Working outside my glasses have tendency to slide down my nose. I wear bifocals and when my glasses do this it makes it difficult for me to see clearly. My Ukes keep this from happening. They are very comfortable and look great.
customer_reviews.author: Steven B.

customer_reviews.title: Best sunglass straps I’ve ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: First pair of sunglass straps I’ve ever liked! Just took them on a four day river trip- they were perfect... The only issue I saw was that they slipped off if the sunglasses were pulled very hard. One could throw a tiny stitch through the end to keep them from opening up and pulling off. Extremely comfortable behind the ears with a snow hat, ball cap, bandanna... Great product, great price!
customer_reviews.author: JLK

customer_reviews.title: Nice Sunglass Saver
customer_reviews.text: was a present for my son. I typically purchase $15 sunglasses so I don't care if I break or lose them. My son however likes the $150-200 Oakleys. Already had a sunglass saving event while tossing a FB around with his buddies at a FL beach. Glasses flew off his head and were directly beside him floating on the top of the waves. VERY nice
customer_reviews.author: david jordan

customer_reviews.title: Cute and Useful
customer_reviews.text: I love the Hawaiian pattern; it is cute and summery. I have a habit of switching out my glasses for my sunglasses, and then spend hours looking for them. This strap makes it simple to keep my sunglasses on me while still wearing the regular glasses. The only negative is is a bit thick near the ear, but I just pull it back a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndrody

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and style
customer_reviews.text: These are my first Ukes. Great quality and fit. Very lightweight - as I hardly know that they are attached. Will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Spartacus

customer_reviews.title: Don't fit on many sunglasses well
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple pair of sunglasses that I wear regularly. Honestly, this doesn't fit them well. It's nearly impossible to slide them onto the glasses, to the point where you could borderline break your glasses. It comes very stiff, perhaps if you wore it more it would loosen up? Idk, if I could do it over again I would have not bought this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dan H

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable securing strap and  good looking
customer_reviews.text: Colorful strap keeps me me from losing my sunglasses, letting them hang on me when not in use and are easier to find when not.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Hurley

customer_reviews.title: The only strap to get for larger arm ends
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME! If the ends of your sunglass arms are wide, then THIS is the ONLY strap to get! I ordered a different kind and almost broke the sunglasses trying to get the strap ON...the neoprene slides on easily and accommodates the larger end AND stays on the arm...VERY comfy to wear and looks GREAT, too! 10 gold stars!
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle

product_meta.title: Ukes Premium Sunglass Strap - Durable & Soft Eyewear Retainer Designed with Floating Neoprene Material - Secure fit for Your Glasses and Eyewear. (The Alohas)
feature_bullets: STAY STRAPPED - Never lose a pair of sunglasses again. Ukes Premium Sunglass Straps will fit securely around the ends of your sunglasses, and keep them on your face. It's inexpensive insurance for your expensive sunglasses. Ukes sunglass holder straps hang comfortably on your chest instead of tightly around your neck. The stretchy Neoprene straps will fit most sunglass frames.

UNIQUE DESIGNS - Choose a style or two that fits your lifestyle, personality, or occasion. Whether you're feeling patriotic, fishing, surfing, stand up paddle boarding, hunting, going to a concert, or attending a Luau, we've got you covered. The soft Neoprene material compliments the sunglass holder strap colors and patterns that will have friends asking "Where'd you get those?"

SOFT - We've sought out the softest, most comfortable material for our Ukes eyewear retainer. The premium Neoprene material is comfy, water proof, and stain resistant. Ukes Premium Sunglass Straps won't irritate your temple or areas around your ear. You will forget they're even there!

DURABLE - Our eyeglass straps have been battle tested in various locations like the oceans, mountains, lakes, rivers, deserts, and forests. Whether its wet, hailing, snowing, windy, or high heat conditions, Ukes sunglass straps can withstand all the elements. They are built to last and won't fade or fall apart. We use them every day!
MONEY BACK GUARANTEE - We absolutely stand by our products. If at any time you're not satisfied with your Ukes glasses strap, go ahead and send it back.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,586 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
